jobDescription: ID Analytics is a leader in credit and fraud risk solutions with patented analytics, proven expertise and up-to-the-minute insight into consumer behavior. Founded in 2002, with a vision to think differently about how institutions solve the problem of verifying consumers’ identities, we now solve a full range of identity challenges, including assessing credit risk and improving online customer experience. Our tools help our clients protect themselves and their customers from identity risk and fraud. Our solutions are all powered by analytics, but it’s our access to data unseen by other bureaus that differentiates our solutions. ID Analytics is a Symantec company.Responsibilities: The Data Scientist Intern’s duties will include, but not be limited to: A research project tailored to their strengths, spanning the domains of machine learning, search, consensus algorithms, graph analytics, process automation etc.Assist the team with the analysis, design, development, testing, and documentation of predictive models, tools, visualizations and algorithms.Building statistical models: after participating in the model design, the intern will work with an experienced modeler in the preparation of data, development of candidate models, evaluation and selection of final models.Completing written documentation and reports of results. This will take the form of business reports, internal technology summaries and statistical analysis.Delivery and presentation of accurate and actionable business and technical analyses to support sales, customer retention, and technology improvement efforts.Desired Qualifications:Prefer candidates working towards Master’s degree or PhD in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related technical field. Consideration will be given to exceptional Bachelor level candidates as well.Prior statistical modeling and/or machine learning experience are desirable.Experience with large data sets, data mining, natural language processing, deep learning and distributed algorithms is highly desirable.Strong coding and scripting skills are required.
